repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: The text of the Avirōtavuntiyār, a Vīraśaiva work of the 17th century by Cāntaliṅkar or Cāntaliṅkacuvāmi, with a commentary. See Zvelebil (1995, p. 89).
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (September 2021).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

collation.desc: the front cover. Bnf shelfmark sticker on the verso.
2 folios = front guard leaves. No foliation. Shelfmark on f[1]r. Title on f[2]r. Element of library binding. Watermarked paper.
96 folios = Avirōtavuntiyār. Tamil foliation {1}-96. Library Arabic foliation 1–96. Watermarked paper. 170 x 115 mm.
93 folios = Avirōtavuntiyār: Text & Commentary. Tamil foliation {1}-93. Library Arabic foliation 1–93. f93v blank.
33 folios = Avirōtavuntiyār: Table of Contents. Tamil foliation 94-96. Library Arabic foliation 94–96. f96v blank.
2 folios = back guard leaves. No foliation. Blank recto verso. Element of library binding. Watermarked paper.

additions.desc: Shelfmark sticker inscribed in black ink: Cc/4 (top of spine).
Title printed in golden letter: Avorītavuntiyār urai. (middle of spine).
BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 361 (bottom of spine).
BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 361 (front cover, recto).
BnF old shelfmark in black pencil: Tamoul 361 (f[1]r).
Title in black pencil: Avorītavuntiyār urai (f[2]r).

List of stanzas (entitled Avirōtavuntiyār aṭivaraivu; no column): stanza designated by pratīkas, preceded by folio reference (yēṭṭu lakkam, "folio number", with mu = muṉ, "recto", and pi = piṉ, "verso") and followed by serial number (pāṭṭu lakkam).

binding.p: Cardboard covered with yellowish canvas. Title and shelfmarks on the spine.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to circa 1800 by Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-) and to 1800 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds. (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments). Not after 1854, since part of the collection of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854), bequeathed in 1855 to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868).

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequeathed by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 52.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 81r, no. 335 361.
Zvelebil, Kamil V. 1995. Lexicon of Tamil Literature. Leiden [etc.]: Brill.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.

revisionDesc.change: Revised by Emmanuel FRANCIS. Version 1, May 2022.
